alert.note: Alert for Naguabo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 28 at 6:39PM ADT until October 28 at 9:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Naguabo County in Puerto Rico... * Until 800 PM AST. * At 539 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 inch is possible. Flash flooding is ongoing, linked to Rio Blanco waters. Emergency managers reported that portions of roads PR-31 and PR-191 are impassable, near exist 22 of PR-31 and along PR-191 in Sector Pitina, Bo. Florida. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. This includes the following streams and drainages... Rio Santiago, Rio Espiritu Santo, Rio Anton Ruiz, Rio Mameyes, Rio Icacos, Rio Blanco, Bahia Algodones to Ensenada Honda Coastal Watersheds, Rio Gurabo, Rio Fajardo and Rio Cubuy. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
